text:
We're encountering issues on Utility where data is not loading.

Getting the following error:
```"The following package names do not match upgradable packages uploaded on this participant: [utility-collateral-app-v0]."```
Has anyone encountered something similar?

text:
I'm not sure if this is feasible on your end, but would it be possible to set up some sort of announcement whenever a new version is released?

That way, we wouldn’t have to manually check the documentation page regularly to see if a new version is available. The last announcement I <https://hydrax.slack.com/archives/C08338ZAL9X/p1752488042442559|saw> in this channel was for the upgrade to version 0.7.1.

elements.text: Hey All, a quick reminder that that the window to upgrade to v0.7.1 on MainNet ends this week on Tuesday, 15th July and that team will be performing maintenance on the Utilities from 9am EST on Wednesday.

attachments.fallback: [July 14th, 2025 3:14 AM] david.richards: Hey All, a quick reminder that that the window to upgrade to v0.7.1 on MainNet ends this week on Tuesday, 15th July and that team will be performing maintenance on the Utilities from 9am EST on Wednesday.

Credentials are loading okay.

Is there a reason you might think of that might result in this?

text:
To add more context:
• Loading has been getting incrementally slower for the past few days
• The past 2 days i have generally been unable to load commercial agreements at all (was trying to pre-emptively top up since the top up app is down)

text:
Trying to deploy Utility using the docker-compose method on MainNet. Went through the doc at <https://docs.digitalasset.com/utilities/0.7/canton-utility-setup/utility-setup-docker-compose.html>. Made necessary changes to .env, compose.yaml and nginx.conf. Created the app in OAuth. When running the start script with:
./start.sh -s "$SPONSOR_SV_URL" -o "" -p "$PARTY_HINT" -m "$MIGRATION_ID" -w -a

I get the following error:
Error response from daemon: Head "<https://digitalasset-canton-network-utility-docker.jfrog.io/v2/frontend/manifests/0.7.4>": unknown: Authentication is required

Is that a permissions issue with the image repository? Or some settings in compose.yaml set incorrectly?

elements.text: Trying to deploy Utility using the docker-compose method on MainNet. Went through the doc at

": unknown: Authentication is required

Is that a permissions issue with the image repository? Or some settings in compose.yaml set incorrectly?
